summary: Viral cute Valentine’s Day interactive single-page site (HTML/CSS/JS) with pastel pink/red kawaii aesthetic, floating hearts, stickers/doodles, smooth shadows/rounded UI, fully responsive for mobile; Screen 1 prompt with evasive “NO THANK YOU”; Screen 2 celebration with animated heart character and 3 gift cards that open gift popups/screens with themed content and animations.
architectural_notes: Single-page interactive HTML/CSS/JS design intended to run locally in Chrome on iPad.
Multi-screen (or modal/popup) UI flow implemented within a single responsive HTML/CSS/JS page with smooth transitions and micro-animations.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine UI that asks the question “Will you be my Valentine?” and presents exactly two prominent options: “Yes” and “No”, using a pink-and-white romantic theme suitable for iPad Chrome.
Implement interactive behavior where the “No” button moves to a different position whenever the user tries to interact with it (e.g., hover/pointer enter), making it effectively unclickable.
Add a touch-friendly fallback so that on touch devices (iPad), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away before a click can be completed.
When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the initial prompt with a celebratory view that displays a meme image and the message “Good choice”.
Add the required generated image asset(s) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them from the frontend (do not fetch images from the backend).

Revamp Screen 1 (main page) UI to a Pinterest/TikTok-style kawaii Valentine aesthetic: soft pastel pink gradient background, small heart doodles/cute decorations, rounded corners, smooth soft shadows, and clean minimal typography; ensure the layout is fully responsive for mobile.

Update Screen 1 content and decorations: add a small “14 FEB” calendar icon in a top corner; add cute bunny/heart sticker-style visuals near the heading; set centered copy to exactly “Hey there,\nWill you be my Valentine?” (line break between greeting and question).

Update Screen 1 buttons to exactly two prominent rounded buttons labeled “YES OF COURSE” and “NO THANK YOU”; make the YES button slightly larger/more inviting than the NO button while keeping both easily tappable on mobile.

Preserve and adapt the evasive interaction for the “NO THANK YOU” button so it moves away on hover (pointer devices) and on tap/press attempt (touch devices), keeping it effectively unclickable while staying within visible bounds of its container on common mobile viewports.

Replace the current post-YES “Good choice” meme view with Screen 2: show big text exactly “Yay, you said yes!\nI made all these for you hehe”; display a cute animated heart character on the left; show three large rounded gift cards/boxes labeled “Gift 1”, “Gift 2”, “Gift 3”; include smooth transitions and soft pop animations when Screen 2 appears and when hovering/tapping gift cards.

Implement Gift 1 as a dedicated screen or modal/popup opened from Screen 2: show a centered bouquet of red roses with a ribbon; place cute message bubbles around it containing exactly these lines: “I will always love you no matter what”, “You are the best part of my life”, “You will forever be my only option”, “I can’t imagine my life without you”; add floating hearts animation on this view.

Implement Gift 2 as a dedicated screen or modal/popup opened from Screen 2: show a short romantic love letter inside a cute card UI (sweet, simple, emotional, not cringe); add sparkles and small hearts as decorative animation elements.

Implement Gift 3 as a dedicated screen or modal/popup opened from Screen 2: show a final screen with big cute messages including exactly “Happy Valentine’s Day ❤️” and “You’re my favorite person”; add a heart burst animation and confetti hearts animation.

Provide navigation affordances for gift views (screen or modal/popup) so the user can return to Screen 2 after viewing a gift, with transitions consistent with the app’s soft pop/smooth animation style.
Integrate all newly required decorative/character/illustration assets as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them from the frontend (no backend image fetching).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed Valentine web page (pink/white) asking 'Will you be my Valentine?' that runs in iPad Chrome using HTML/CSS/JS.
Add Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking.
On Yes click, display a meme image with the message 'Good choice'.

Revamp UI to Pinterest/TikTok-style kawaii aesthetic: pastel pink gradient background, heart doodles, bunny/heart stickers, rounded corners, soft shadows, clean minimal typography, and fully responsive mobile layout.
Add Screen 1 details: top-corner “14 FEB” calendar icon, centered copy “Hey there, Will you be my Valentine?”, YES OF COURSE (larger/more inviting) and NO THANK YOU (evasive on hover/tap).

Add Screen 2 after YES: message “Yay, you said yes! I made all these for you hehe”, animated heart character on the left, and 3 large rounded gift cards (Gift 1/2/3) with smooth transitions/pop animations.

Implement Gift 1/2/3 popups or screens: Gift 1 roses bouquet with ribbon + message bubbles + floating hearts; Gift 2 romantic love letter card with sparkles/hearts; Gift 3 final cute message with heart burst + confetti hearts animation.
